Detailed Description

The D3D index buffer implementation.

Use the create / lock / set methods to realise the functionality. This is purely a helper for the creation of the D3D index buffer objects, meaning an instance of this object can represent any type of index buffer desired. A ComObjectWrap class is used to Administer the D3D object.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

Moo::IndexBuffer::IndexBuffer (  )  [inline]

Member Function Documentation

void Moo::IndexBuffer::addToPreloadList (  )  [inline]

This method adds the index buffer to the preload list in the render context.

This causes the buffer to have its preload method called in the next few frames, so that it is uploaded to video memory. This is only useful for managed pool resources.
